docs.snippet: The Yankees had a lot going for them as they came to Toronto but lost the opener of a three-game series after the first-place Blue Jays batted around in the second inning....

docs.abstract: Toronto Blue Jays beat New York Yankees, 8-3.

headline.main: Blue Jays’ Big Inning Helps Keep Yankees at a Distance

docs.snippet: Since switching to less lively bats and a different ballpark in 2011, offense in college baseball is down, and changes are being considered for the sport’s premier event in Omaha....
docs.lead_paragraph: Since switching to less lively bats and a different ballpark in 2011, offense in college baseball is down, and changes are being considered for the sport’s premier event in Omaha.
docs.abstract: Decline in college baseball offense continues after NCAA’s switch to less lively bats in 2011 for safety and competitive reasons; for the first time since the introduction of aluminum bats in 1974, there are no home runs in the first eight games of College World Series.

headline.main: Homer Happiness Lives Only in Memory
headline.print_headline: Homer Happiness Lives Only in Memory

docs.snippet: The World Cup game drew 18.2 million viewers Sunday evening on ESPN, while another 6.5 million watched on Univision....
docs.lead_paragraph: The World Cup game drew 18.2 million viewers Sunday evening on ESPN, while another 6.5 million watched on Univision.
docs.abstract: World Cup game between the United States and Portugal has highest ratings for any soccer game telecast in America and reaches more viewers than events like the NBA finals or the World Series.

headline.seo: TV Ratings in U.S.-Portugal Tie Show World Cup’s Draw
headline.main: Bigger Than Baseball: 25 Million Watch U.S.-Portugal World Cup Match

docs.snippet: In a ruling that could force sports teams to reassess how their mascots interact with spectators, the Missouri Supreme Court on Tuesday ordered a new trial for a Kansas City Royals fan who was injured by a hot dog tossed at a baseball game....
docs.lead_paragraph: In a ruling that could force sports teams to reassess how their mascots interact with spectators, the Missouri Supreme Court on Tuesday ordered a new trial for a Kansas City Royals fan who was injured by a hot dog tossed at a baseball game.

headline.main: Court: Royals Fan Hit by Hot Dog Gets New Trial

docs.snippet: A player suing ex-major leaguer Jose Offerman for a bat-wielding attack at a minor league baseball game in 2007 says Offerman has repeatedly failed to show up for depositions to provide testimony as the case heads to trial....
